from plotly.offline import iplot
import plotly. graph_objs as go

daily_new_cases = go.Scatter(x=df1.index, y=df1['daily_new_cases'], yaxis='y1', name='Daily confirmed cases')
daily_vaccinations = go.Scatter(x=df2.index, y=df2['daily_vaccinations'], yaxis='y2', name='Daily vacctinations')

layout_obj = go.Layout(title='COVID vs. Vaccines', xaxis=dict(title='Date'), yaxis=dict(title='Daily cases'), yaxis2=dict(title='Vacctinations', side='right', overlaying='y'))
fig = go.Figure(data=[daily_new_cases, daily_vaccinations], layout=layout_obj)
iplot(fig)
fig.write_html('outcome.html')

From the ranking tables I made, we can find that Canada is **#22** for the total number of cases and **#97** for the total vaccinations per number of people.

Despite the serious situation, the vaccination does not spread enough. The ranking suggests that the total vaccinations per number of people # 97 in the world. It is estimated that Canada is behind the OEDC avarage because most of the developed countries is above Canada's position in the ranking.

According to Canadian Broadcasting Corporation (CBC) COVID-19 tracker, yesterday (May 26th, 2021) was 2,594. As you can recognize from the graphs which I made, now Canada seems to be at the end of the thrid wave of the infection.
